name: AddPeopleToSegment
description:
Add people to a manual segment by ID.

This tool adds people to a pre-existing manual segment using customer identifiers. It supports up to 1000 customer IDs per request, using identifiers like `id`, `email`, or `cio_id` based on the `id_type` query parameter. Note that this is limited to manual segments, not data-driven ones.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a manual segment. This can be found on its page in the dashboard or via the App API.

value_schema.description: The identifier for a segment. You can find your segment's ID on its page in the dashboard—go to *Segments*, select your segment, and find the ID under *Usage*. Or you can find your segment using the [App API](#tag/Segments).

parameters.name: identifier_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of identifiers in the `ids` array, such as `id`, `email`, or `cio_id`. Defaults to `id`.

value_schema.description: The type of `ids` you want to use. All of the values in the `ids` array must be of this type. If you don't provide this parameter, we assume that the `ids` array contains `id` values.

parameters.name: customer_ids
parameters.description: A JSON array of customer identifiers (IDs, emails, or cio_ids) to add to the segment. Ensure all match the specified `id_type`.

ids.description: The customer IDs you want to add to the segment. The type of value you pass in the array corresponds to the `id_type` query parameter—`id`, `email`, or `cio_id`. Entries in the array that don't match the `id_type` are ignored.
